text:
Hello, Please help, i want to add json in a text_field and then parse it. ```{% for key, val in module.text_field.items() %} {{ key }}: {{ val }}
{% endfor %}``` My JSON tht i paste in module.text_field: ```{"name": "Cool Product", "price": "$20", "size":"XL"}``` And it doesen't work, adding JSON like: ```{% set dict_var = {"name": "Cool Product", "price": "$20", "size":"XL"} %} {% for key, val in dict_var.items() %} {{ key }}: {{ val }}
{% endfor %}``` Works, but not from if JSON is coming from text_field.

Hello,

Is anybody here who have created a custom module of JSON structured data (Schema Markup) for a single blog post ?

I would like to implement an option 2 in the article below, but don’t know how. Can you kindly let me know how to do it ?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/how-to-use-structured-data-schema-markup-in-HubSpot-to-improve-seo>

Thanks in advance:pray:

you’ll want to use the fromjson filter to parse the string into a dictionary
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#fromjson>
Hi there, had a question for HubSpot though not sure if this is the right place to ask. Wanted to know if and when there is a plan to update the Twitter logo to X on the Social Sharing module?

Taking a look in design tools, it looks as if the Social Sharing module _(also the_ `follow_me_lp` _module)_ has been updated with a `twitter_icon` field that allows you to pick between the bird and the X logo. In the page editor interface, this should appear as a dropdown under the “Twitter” field group.

This update seems to have been pushed to all portals — not just new ones.
